intro: Neobartsia alba, commonly known as the white bartsia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rhamnaceae. It is native to certain regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Thailand and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Neobartsia alba is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
